title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 7100.3 - Commission vacancies
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 7100.3 - Commission vacancies

State Regulations

Commission membership is governed by section
62
of the

Judiciary Law. No later than 60 days prior to the occurrence of a scheduled
vacancy on the commission, and as soon as practicable for any other vacancy on
the commission, notice will be published on the commission's website, distributed to the media, bar associations throughout the State and other
persons and organizations (as registered with the commission under section
7100.11
of this Part), and sent in
writing to the relevant appointing authority. This notice will be accompanied
by a statement that the ultimate objectives of wide diversity and broad
outreach in the nomination of well qualified candidates for the Court of

Appeals are best served by a commission that itself reflects the diversity of

New York's citizenry. The statement will further note that, consistent with the
commission's own commitment to diversity, as set forth in section
7100.8
(e) of this

Part, appointing authorities should consider appointing highly qualified
individuals from a variety of backgrounds. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
7100.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
